hedline.hl1: Where School's Expansion And Environment Intersect

abstract.p: Long Island Pine Barrens Society executive director Richard Amper letter disputes April 30 article on planned expansion of Ross School into South Fork Pine Barrens (S)

block.p: The hypocrisy of the Ross School was not reflected in ''A Garden of Learning, Growing Like a Weed?'' [April 30].

Opponents of the 484,000-square-foot expansion of the campus in the South Fork Pine Barrens are not subordinating progressive education to environmental preservation. We're supporting both. The school expansion is simply too much development in the worst possible place.
The hypocrisy of the Ross School was not reflected in ''A Garden of Learning, Growing Like a Weed?'' [April 30].

Opponents of the 484,000-square-foot expansion of the campus in the South Fork Pine Barrens are not subordinating progressive education to environmental preservation. We're supporting both. The school expansion is simply too much development in the worst possible place.

The Ross Institute's environmental impact statement says the school is ''promoting a respect for and awareness of the local environment.'' Quite the contrary. It is employing enormous wealth and power trying to bulldoze Long Island's premier ecosystem. What a bad lesson and example for the children!
RICHARD AMPER Executive Director Long Island Pine Barrens Society
